Hi everyone, I know how terrible it feels right now if you are new in this sector. Prozac (fluoxetine):I was prescribed this first before I started my ADHD meds. I have been on SSRIs before. I don't really respond to them, good or bad. The only positive I noted during my time on this medication was less frequent/repetitive thoughts and more indifference to things. I was only 5mg for 1 year. I couldn't take 10mg because I am sensitive to medication and even 5mg gave me the side effects I will discuss below. Insomnia: I could not sleep. I had to be prescribed sleep medication while on Prozac. I used to be able to fall asleep fine, even if I was depressed, I would rather sleep than not. I would get maybe 6 hours and then wake up with energy and I didn't like it. I always felt like my body was secretly tired if my mind would just let it be. Headaches, teeth grinding made worse, and in turn, neck pain, shoulder pain. Less appetite, no weight loss or gain. Vivid dreams, some violent in the beginning. Weird digestion. Felt on edge at times. My nose is no longer stuffy either so allergies?

Prozac (fluoxetine):Hello, I wanted to share my experience because when I was in the thick of my depression and reluctantly decided to try antidepressants, I was absolutely terrified and it was reading reviews on here that really helped me stick it out and have hope for a better future. Prozac/Fluoxetine has honestly changed my life. In the best way ever. I had so many symptoms that I thought were just personality traits that I can see now was actually my anxiety and depression. I used to worry so much about everything and had terrible insomnia because of it. I was completely reliant on sleep aids and was always overwhelmed with work so much that I was taking sick days very regularly. Prozac did take about 8 weeks to start working for me. So you do need to be very patient. But I feel so much better now. I don’t feel any different, just think clearer and no longer sweat the small things. If you’re struggling, please don’t be scared. It might be the best decision you make.

I was put on this for moderate depression as a teen (13-15yo). It bumped my mood up a little bit at the start, but all in all it wasn't very effective for me, feeling almost like a sugar pill. I kept getting worse and ended up in hospital at age 15, where they first maxed the dose to no avail and then switched me to Cymbalta, which finally helped. I'd say to other teens and parents of adolescents (or anyone else interested) that there's much worse things you or your child could try to relieve their anguish with than this pill. Its effectiveness is up to the individual though, and you will need to practise keeping up your emotional health in other ways too. A word of warning: not all doctors will check for it or remember (mine didn't), but you NEED to tell them about other medication you are taking! Due to the way this medication breaks down in the body, it can interact with other drugs and raise their levels.

This medication should be illegal, on the first day that I took it I developed SEVERE autism symptoms, I started holding onto certain objects and shook them rapidly while making caveman noises for hours on end, when it came time to sleep I could not sleep AT ALL. I had this sad song I listened to earlier in the day before taking my first dose of fluoxetine stuck inside my head all night, the worst part is that the song literally sounded horrible to me, even though I liked it before. It sounded totally awful and I didn't feel the music one bit, it just sounded like a sequence of noises put together. Then came NIGHTMARES, I had them whilst I was awake somehow (hallucinations or something) I couldn't even explain what was going on, I stopped after taking it for 2 weeks, after I stopped I became manic and felt suicidal. The police came to my house about 47 times in the span of 2 months.

For all of you that are struggling please please give this drug a try , it’s my second time on it , as I thought I was ready to come off of it but slipped back a little when I did. I only take one 20 mg tablet every other day as that is all I need, and I will soon get that down to 1 tablet a week. It’s just enough to keep my brain in check. It does take a 2 / 4 weeks to kick in but when it does, trust me you will know. I feel like my old self again. It’s not such a big deal trust me. There is a way out of this, please don’t give up, I believe in you. Don’t listen to the negativity in your head , you are just blinded by the depression atm . Keep fighting

Prozac (fluoxetine):It helped a lot with my depression but I had to stop taking it because of side effects. It made me manic. Also caused me to sweat profusely even in a cold air conditioned room I would sweat like crazy.

Prozac (fluoxetine):Hi guys ,  I have depression, OCD and anxiety.  I am  a 42 years old man married with kids and have struggled with depression all my life and  I've been on and off meds during different periods. During the last year I took zoloft 200mg  for several months, it helped with anxiety but made me sleep too much. My doctor switched me to prozac 40mg in the morning which I've been on for about 6 months now. I felt a bit less tired and foggy. It definitely ended my panic attacks and anxiety but I still feel sluggish and struggle to get things done in and out of the home. If you have panic attacks and anxiety with depression this could help you. I appreciate the positive influence it has had on my state of mind but I still feel like I'm tired and struggling to be productive at work.

Prozac (fluoxetine):It took a full 7 weeks to have any tangible result. In fact the first few weeks were tormented but my GP told me to carry on with it come hell or high water.  I did actually quit taking it initially but tried again through desperation. Made me feel extremely anxious and panicky in the beginning but I found the tool of mindful meditation to be an excellent antidote to panic. I didn't believe prozac would have any effect but I now find it very helpful indeed. I also got rid of the stressors in my life (poor job fit and bad relationship) and learnt how not to ruminate. I had a small amount of alcohol once after the 3 week and it made me feel very ill on Prozac so I have stopped drinking beer. I have tried other ADs before but couldn't stomach the side effects and I have to admit that I had to swallow my pride before swallowing Prozac as I used to think depression was for weaklings when in fact it is rather the opposite kind of people who suffer from it.

Started on 10mg for 10 days then 20mg. After 5 days I had to go back to 10mg. 20mg made me way too tired to drive. I drive long distance for work so was to dangerous.Here are the symptoms I was having before prozac.Suicidal ideation,  major depression and anxiety. I no longer suffer from any of it. It has definitely given me the mental break I needed so badly.  I did experience nausea,  dizziness at the beginning. I'm on my 4th week and have lost 2lbs. I don't feel as hungry.

I have had a good experience with it so far, with only minor bad moments.

I hope this review gives hope to someone searching for it. I used to obsessively read these reviews everyday. I take 20mg of fluoxetine. First 2 weeks side effects were: headaches, vaginal bleeding, fatigue, yawning, no appetite. Weeks 2-5 worsening of anxiety, depression, increased suicidal thoughts. Week 6 my head became clearer, anxiety subsided and I had motivation to get up in the morning. I began to see the beauty in the world again and appreciate the smallest things. The following also helped: running, being outside as much as possible, routine (getting up and going to bed at the same time), healthy diet, cutting out alcohol, journaling, reading, wordsearches, deleting social media, CBT. Find what works for you. Establish a safety plan for the first 5 weeks. Phone the Samaritans (I phoned them regularly). Remind yourself or get someone else to remind you that you won’t always feel this way. This is temporary. Give this medication time, be patient and be kind to yourself.
